channel.title: UN in Focus on UN-aligned
channel.description: Recent content in UN in Focus on UN-aligned

item.title: Another US Condemns Gaza to Further Genocide
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: As Trump and Netanyahu cosy up in Washington again with fresh talks on Gaza, one thing is certain: there is no Israeli atrocity, however diabolical, that the US will not back. Here I pick at Dorothy Shea’s narrative after yet another US veto blocking moves to put an end to the genocide.

item.title: Revitalising Global Engagement: The Case for a United Nations Peace Corps
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: A UN Peace Corps can transform global indifference into active engagement, leveraging the American Peace Corps model to foster international cooperation and make a tangible impact in the global South.

item.title: 'No place for the politicisation of aid': Why the West's UNRWA fund cuts are nakedly political
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: While accountability for wrongdoing of UNRWA is necessary, collective punishment that exacerbates the suffering of the vulnerable is neither just nor effective.

item.title: Frail and Ambiguous Words: How Diplomacy Hinders Peace in Gaza
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: In the UN's high-stakes negotiations, a pivotal linguistic duel over 'cessation' versus 'suspension' casts Gaza's fate into uncertainty.

item.title: Redefining Peacekeeping: The Case for a United Nations Corps of Peacekeeping Engineers
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: A proposed UN Corps of Peacekeeping Engineers could shift the focus from mere conflict containment to active infrastructural revival in war-torn states.

item.title: A Council in Deadlock: The UN's Faltering Quest for Peace in Gaza
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: UN peace efforts in Gaza are criticised as Security Council vetoes block cease-fire moves and expose the General Assembly's limited power.

item.title: Palestine and the UN: Will this 794th letter jolt the Security Council into action?
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: In his 794th plea to the UN, Riyad H. Mansour exposes the unchecked horrors in Palestine, but can the UN overcome its inertia and respond, or will inaction deepen the global human tragedy?

item.title: '24 Years of Missed Opportunities': How the UN Failed to Secure Peace in the DRC
item.author: Alexander Stoney
item.description: As the UN's longest-standing peacekeeping mission faces a turbulent exit from the Democratic Republic of Congo, what were its critical failings, and what can the UN learn from them?

item.title: The Global Constitution: And Why we Need it
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: In a world beset by rising nationalism and a chronic disregard for global responsibility, could a world constitution steer us towards peace and prosperity?

item.title: Preserving Peace and Heritage: Converting Woodrow Wilson's Vision into a UN World Park Service
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: Could Wilson's US National Park Service inspire a UN World Park Service to preserve ecological and historic sites, promote international cooperation, and appreciate cultural heritage?

item.title: World Peace Now Secure: Fugitive War Criminal Assumes UN Peacekeeping Chief Role
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: As Russia takes over the UN Security Council presidency, the world confronts the baffling irony of a nation, embroiled in the Ukraine war and led by a convicted war criminal, guiding an organisation entrusted with the preservation of global peace and security.

item.title: The 3 Scenarios of Russia’s Removal from the UN Security Council: A Bleak Future or a Chance for a Fresh Start?
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: Russia's permanent seat on the UN Security Council is under scrutiny like never before. What would happen if the UN decided to expel this rogue state from the Security Council? Will it lead to war, polarisation, or perhaps a new beginning for the UN?

item.title: The New International Man: Can World Federalism Overcome Nationalism?
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: Exploring the concept of the ‘New Soviet Man’ and how a modern-day equivalent could promote world federalism and overcome nationalism.

item.title: 6 Solutions to Overhaul the United Nations Security Council
item.author: Dinojah.Patkunarajah
item.description: Six game-changing proposals to reform the UN Security Council and restore global peace

item.title: Odessa's Cultural Heritage Threatened by Ongoing Conflict in Ukraine
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: Despite being inscribed on UNESCO's World Heritage List, the historical Ukrainian city of Odessa struggles to protect its monuments from the effects of war.

item.title: ‘Like heads in the sand’: United Nations Votes on Israeli Occupation
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: The recent UN General Assembly vote on the Israeli occupation of Palestinian territories sheds light on the disturbing trend of political ignorance amongst powerful nations.

item.title: Bye bye United Nations: A Jolly Good Move!
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: Angelina Jolie, has decided to quit her role as a Special Envoy to the United Nations refugee agency citing a desire to “work differently”.

item.title: Iran's Removal from the Commission on the Status of Women: Change in Membership Standards?
item.author: Dinojah.Patkunarajah
item.description: The UN has removed Iran from the Commission on the Status of Women for violations against women's rights, but many countries with poor records remain on the council.

item.title: The Case for Permanent Continental Members at the UN Security Council
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: Empowering continents and ensuring lasting peace - a case for permanent continental members at the UN Security Council

item.title: The Montreux Declaration: An Alternative Vision for World Peace
item.author: unregisteredauthor
item.description: The Montreux Declaration presents a coherent alternative to the UN's design flaws for achieving genuine world peace, argues Lukas Pfluger.

item.title: Can the United Nations Parliamentary Assembly Address Failed State Realities?
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: With poverty, corruption, and functional illiteracy affecting many nations, can the UN Parliamentary Assembly's proposal for representative democracy succeed?

item.title: UN votes on a fact-finding mission into Iran, but don’t look at it too closely
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: The UN HRC approved a fact-finding investigation into human rights violations in Iran. However, the vote reveals three disturbing facts about the Council and its ability to protect human rights.

item.title: UN Security Council: Differences over Haiti
item.author: Elvira_Ineza
item.description: The UN Security Council finally establishes sanctions regime on Haiti to punish actors threatening peace and security.

item.title: Russia booted out of the UN Human Rights Council. What's next?
item.author: Elvira_Ineza
item.description: Following the General Assembly declaring the annexation of Ukrainian illegal, Russia's presence on the UN Security Council has officially lost its legal basis.

item.title: UNICEF and WHO: Alarm over cholera outbreaks
item.author: Elvira_Ineza
item.description: As Cholera outbreak spreads across 29 countries, UNICEF calls for 27.5 million to combat disease.

item.title: What is the World Atomic Weapons Disarmament Agency (WAWDA) and why do we need it
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: The IAEA has successfully preserved the spirit nuclear disarmament, but today we know that the enforcement of international law fails without a multilateral body of enforcement.

item.title: How to Make War Redundant
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: People and nations may disagree, they may commit crimes, but these antagonisms can be resolved in countless ways. Why war?

item.title: Here are what your leaders had to say at the UN General Debate 2022
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: Quickly catch up with some of the best/worst quotes of the United Nations General Assembly debates.

item.title: China in Focus at UN "Selective Rights Council" (UNRC)
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: The Human Rights Council passed a resolution on the protection against violence and discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

item.title: The need for an International Anti-Corruption Court (IACC) is greater than ever before
item.author: Omar Alansari-Kreger
item.description: While the ICC is busy with sanctimonious show trials in the Global South, the need for a supranational criminal court that prosecutes corruption without fear and favour is rising.
